p: Almost all the treatments resulted in increase in oleic acid contents in cultivar Thori; however, treatment SPQ ( Azospirillum supplemented with quarter dose of NP fertilizers) resulted in maximum significant increase (34%) in oleic acid contents compared to the control ( Fig 2C). Maximum significant increase (17%) in oleic acid was resulted in BTQ treatment ( Azotobacter with quarter dose of NP fertilizers) compared to the control in cultivar Saif-32. Single inoculation of Azospirillum (SP) and Azotobacter (BT) resulted in 5â€“6% increase in oleic acid contents over the control. The cultivar Thori was more pronounced in increasing the oleic acid contents as compared to cultivar Saif-32.
